Package util

Class GeneralTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.GeneralTools
  • public class GeneralTools
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encloses a set of general purpose methods that can be used across multiple scenarios.
    Version:
    0.9.9.9
    Author:
    Ricardo Rodrigues

    • Method Detail

      • formatTime

        public static java.lang.String formatTime​(long milliseconds)
        Formats a time given in milliseconds, dividing it in milliseconds, seconds, minutes and hours, using the format hh:mm:ss.ms (for instance, 12:34:56.789). Take notice that hours can have a value greater than or equal to 24, as days are not accounted for.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - the time to be formatted
        Returns:
        the formatted time

      • isNumber

        public static boolean isNumber​(java.lang.String arg,
                               char decimalMark)
        Verifies if the given argument is a number. It handles positive, negative, and decimal values.
        Parameters:
        arg - the argument to be tested if it is a number or not
        decimalMark - the character used as a decimal mark
        Returns:
        the result of the test

      • split

        public static java.lang.String[] split​(java.lang.String text,
                                       java.util.regex.Pattern pattern,
                                       boolean appendDelimiters)
        The array returned by this method contains each substring of the given text that is terminated by another substring that matches the given expression or is terminated by the end of the text. The substrings in the array are in the order in which they occur in the text. If the expression does not match any part of the input then the resulting array has just one element, namely the String that represents the text. (This method is provided here just for convenience, providing an alternative to the same method in class String, being now possible the inclusion of the delimiters. It can be specially useful in parsing sentences in a text.)
        Parameters:
        text - the text to be split
        pattern - the pattern (a regular expression used to split the text
        appendDelimiters - whether delimiters should or be not also included in the retrieved array whit all the tokens resulting from the split
        Returns:
        a String array computed by splitting the text around matches of the given regular expression

      • escapeRegExMetacharacters

        public static java.lang.String escapeRegExMetacharacters​(java.lang.String text)
        Replaces each of the so called metacharacters in a regular expression by their escaped counterparts. An escaped version of the text is returned. The metacharacters are [\ˆ$.|?*+()].
        Parameters:
        text - the text to be "escaped"
        Returns:
        a String with the "escaped" text

      • mergeStringArrays

        public static java.lang.String[] mergeStringArrays​(java.lang.String[] oneStringArray,
                                                   java.lang.String[] anotherStringArray)
        This method facilitates the merging of two arrays of strings. It receives two arrays and returns another array resulting from the merging of the given arrays. Repeated elements on both arrays will have just one copy in the new array.
        Parameters:
        oneStringArray - one of the arrays to be merged
        anotherStringArray - the other array
        Returns:
        an array resulting from the merging of the two given arrays

      • isAllCaps

        public static boolean isAllCaps​(java.lang.String word)
        This method checks whether all the characters in a given string are capitals.
        Parameters:
        word - the string to be checked
        Returns:
        true if all the characters are capitals, or false, otherwise

      • isCapitalized

        public static boolean isCapitalized​(java.lang.String word)
        This method checks whether the first character in a given string is capital.
        Parameters:
        word - the string to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the first character is capital, or false, otherwise or if the string is empty

      • capitalize

        public static java.lang.String capitalize​(java.lang.String word)
        This method capitalizes the first character of a given string, returning the new string obtained this way. If the string is empty, or its first character is already capitalized or a digit, it is returned the same string.
        Parameters:
        word - the string to have its first character capitalizes
        Returns:
        a new string with its first character capitalized

      • countOccurrences

        public static int countOccurrences​(java.lang.String haystack,
                                   char needle)
        This method counts the occurrences of a character in a given string.
        Parameters:
        haystack - the string to be analyzed
        needle - the character to be searched for
        Returns:
        the number of occurrences

      • listFiles

        public static java.io.File[] listFiles​(java.io.File directory)
        This method lists recursively all files in a given directory and in its subdirectories.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory to list the files from
        Returns:
        an array with the files found

      • listFiles

        public static java.io.File[] listFiles​(java.io.File directory,
                                       boolean recursive)
                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method lists all files in a given directory and, optionally, in its subdirectories.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory to list the files from
        recursive - whether the listing should be recursive or not
        Returns:
        an array with the files found
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • listFiles

        public static java.io.File[] listFiles​(java.io.File directory,
                                       java.lang.String extension)
                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method lists recursively all files in a given directory and its subdirectories, that end with the given extension.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory to list the files from
        extension - the extension the files should end with
        Returns:
        an array with the files found
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • listFiles

        public static java.io.File[] listFiles​(java.io.File directory,
                                       java.lang.String extension,
                                       boolean recursive)
                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method lists recursively all files in a given directory and its subdirectories, that comply to the given filter.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory to list the files from
        extension - the extension the files should end with
        recursive - whether the listing should be recursive or not
        Returns:
        an array with the files found
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • readConfigurationData

        public static java.lang.String[] readConfigurationData​(java.io.InputStream configData,
                                                       java.lang.String comment)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        This method reads typical configuration files (or other resources), with commented out lines.
        Parameters:
        configData - the configuration data
        comment - the symbol used to comment out lines
        Returns:
        an array with the configuration lines
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
